required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Range of Motion and Stretching
clinical_study.official_title: Immediate Changes in Cervical Range of Motion and Myofascial Sensitivity After Standardized Manual Stretches: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Cervical range of motion (ROM) is necessary to perform normal activities of daily living and deficits are associate with various pathologies. Currently, its unclear if specific myofascial stretches will improve cervical range of motion and decrease myofascial sensitivity. After a single session of the manual stretching procedure, participants immediately demonstrated increased cervical ROM and pressure pain thresholds.

detailed_description.textblock: Methods: Sixty participants with no history of neck pain or trauma were randomized into one of two groups: stretching group (n = 30), or control group (n = 30). The stretching group received a standardized manual stretching protocol. The control group did not received intervention. Pre and Post-test measurements were recorded for both groups. Within group differences and group by time interactions were evaluated for Cervical range of motion ROM and myofascial sensitivity. The immediate improvement in active ROM of the cervical spine may prompt clinicians to consider the sequencing of treatment. Stretching prior to active exercises may allow for active exercise through a larger ROM. Future research is needed to evaluate the immediate effects of stretching in the symptomatic population.

study_design_info.masking_description: Assessor of dependent variables was blinded to group assignment

primary_outcome.description: CROM including flexion, extension, side bending left, side bending right, rotation left, and rotation right

secondary_outcome.description: The PPT was recorded using a Wagner FDX-25 hand-held digital pressure algometer (Wagner Instruments, Greenwich, CT). The investigator performed each assessment uniformly by applying force at the same rate of 5 Pa/second.

arm_group.description: The control group did not received intervention and sat on a table for approximately 5 minutes
The stretching group received a standardized manual stretching protocol

intervention.description: Manual stretching for the upper trapezius and levator scapulae muscle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ages of 18-60
- active cervical flexion, right lateral flexion OR left cervical lateral flexion <45Ëš
Exclusion Criteria:
- minors
- prisoners
- individuals with cognitive impairments
- recent neck surgeries
- pre-existing neck injuries
